intro: Trichotosia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved trichotosia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Trichotosia microphylla is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
